review:
Hey guys, does anyone know how to get Overwatch 1? i can't find it anywhere and i heard it has all the heroes unlocked and awesome skins that you can get from just playing the game (a very rare thing in our modern world of video games). I heard a lot of good things about the game so I would like to experience the franchise from the very beginning!

with much thanks, 
emi~

If you're the kind of person that enjoy playing MOBAs with Friends, do please play Overwatch 2 with Friends. 

If on the other end you intend in making any purchases do please keep in mind that Blizzard will have no respect for your money. You will have much more fun going outside spreading your hard spend â‚¬$Â£ in the streets I guarantee you. 

We reached the point were we MISS THE TIME WHEN LOOTBOXES WERE THE MAIN THING, so instead of promoting this predatory enterprise, do yourself a favor. Have fun, play the game, don't fall for the skins. 
The game is good free, if you cannot stand the grind go somewhere else.

What is up everyone, this is [b]not[/b] Jeff from the Overwatch team.
overwatch players sexually harassed me like how blizzard teams sexually harass their coworkers

I was all in for Overwatch 1 right from the start. Bought it as soon as it dropped and had a blast teaming up with my brother. Then along comes OW2, and I'm back on board, especially with the PvE mode news. I even got myself the S1 battle pass, all hyped up to have some Deep Rock Galactic-level fun in Overwatch 2.

But man, my excitement got deflated like a popped balloon when they revealed that they ditched the PvE idea and handed out those half-hearted missions we've seen in past events â€“ except now they want 15 bucks a pop for each one! It's sad that blizzard is now a greedy company that has no love for their game, they are going down and took a great game down with them. I can't give this one a thumbs-up, no chance.

Shoutout to the first review here â€“ you've hit the nail on the head, at least Blizzard gave us great characters that have inspired great art ( Í¡Â° ÍœÊ– Í¡Â°) LOL

[i]"However, arguably the most troubling accusation listed in the lawsuit is the reveal that one unnamed female Activision worker committed suicide while on a company trip with an unnamed â€œmale supervisor.â€ She was allegedly the victim of â€œintense sexual harassmentâ€ to the point where nude pictures of her were circulated during a company holiday party." [/i]

I spent money on this game.. I want it back blizzard.

"Whats the best way to sell Overwatch 2" "Lie to the players for 3 years"
I don't think, I have to say anything about this game.

I thought I only had room in my life for one game that caused me to often lament its failed potential, and that game is Destiny 2.

However, I have some friends that want to play Overwatch 2, so I guess I'll try and play this, too. I've been playing this game since the Beta of Overwatch 1. I can't really say that I HATE this game now, but I really don't like it anymore, either.

It's another game where it seems pretty obvious that the management don't really know what to do with it anymore. In an interview, they were really pushing for new PvE modes these past couple years because... (checks notes)... they wanted to turn Overwatch 2 into an MMO in the future. Does that sound reasonable to you? Thankfully they realized their scope was insane, then CANCELLED the PvE modes, then... un-cancelled the PvE modes to sell them as a few missions in the game. 

As far as the PvE modes go, they're fine. Fun-ish. They're about the same as the PvE modes they released years ago. So here we are years later, with about the same stuff as we got years ago.

Is the game fun? Yes kinda, but it's so focused on being competitive that almost all modes turn ultra sweaty.
Is the game competitive? Yes kinda, but because they also try to cater to a "casual audience" with some of their modes, the competitive aspect of the game doesn't feel as polished as it should.

If you're looking for a fun casual PvP experience, you can find much better games. If you're looking for a fun PvE experience, you can find much better games. If you're looking for a refined competitive experience, you can find much better games.

This isn't the worst game in the world, but every time I play it, I can't help but feel like I've had my fun with Overwatch, and I'm not sure why I'm playing anymore. Well, I know why. I have a couple friends that still like it, so that's good enough for now I guess. It's possible they can improve Overwatch 2 a lot again, but I won't hold my breath. For now I'll play it whenever my friends want. The second they aren't interested anymore though, it's straight to uninstall.

The game itself is amazing. Monetization and company behind it definitely is not. The overall gameplay and experience I find quite enjoyable, so if you want a shooter game and donâ€™t care about/plan to spend money on it, itâ€™s a good game.

Used to be an awesome game with reasonable balance containing some fair and unfair moments in it, but still fun to play. Game speed was optimal. Gameplay was clear and visible. There was pretty high entry threshold on some heroes but it felt rewarding to master them.
But now its all gone. Each new character generete tons of particals and effects that preventing you from orienting in game, even on low graphics. After switching to 5v5 mode game speed increased drastically wich affects heavily on aim and movement. Becouse of that you constantly feel unsatisfied in fights even if your team is winning.
And of course monetization issues and broken promises. How would you feel when your favorite game you once bought suddenly becoming f2p (p2p if you want to play new heroes on their release date) with battlepass system. Game where you could get all event customization items just playing it, instead of buying them in shop for $15 each. When last hope of what ow2 deserves to be dies with promised pve content.
You would feel empty. I certanly am.
I installed this, just so I could leave a negative review.

Rubbish company Blizzard, hope to close down soon

Well, Overwatch 2 is finally on Steam. Let's look back on what has happened up to this point.

âœ“ Game of the Year 2016.
âœ“ Incredible Cinematics.
âœ“ Amazing diversity of Characters.
âœ“ Solid gameplay with a variety of habilities and ways to play.
âœ“ Spearhead of eSports becoming mainstream with Overwatch League.
âœ“ Stadiums, Merch, events with VAs, special announcements.
âœ“ Incredibly talented artists that make visually impressive content such as skins, maps, even sound.
âœ“ Lootboxes that were pretty generous if the player just plays for a little while per week, easy to get all the new content being released.
âœ“ Over 40M copies sold...

X Several grave controversies involving the company.
X For a game with a setting about being included and being a hero, they completely blocked people's words and desperation in a time of need for Hong Kong.
X Stopped giving constant updates, got lazy.
X Very bad patch notes that were unable to break a boring meta that stayed relevant for over an entire year.
X Unable to fix several issues that plagued the first game such as toxicity, smurfing, broken strats.
X A very good lore, but painfully slow to actually develop and progress to the point where majority doesn't care about it anymore.
X Broken promises.
X Overwatch 1 was left to rot and suffer a slow death while all their focus were on Overwatch 2 for almost 3 whole years.
X Papa Jeff is gone.

So, what is Overwatch 2? It's is supposed to be a rebirth, make the game relevant and incredible again. It's nothing more than a fresh coat of paint to Overwatch 1 with a few key differences. PvE, the main advertisement of the game and the "reason" it exists won't ever be released, so all those lost years of suffering a dying game was for nothing.
Blizzard now shows their true predatory nature, the game does not respect you. New heroes have to be unlocked on the Battle Pass, the progress is extremely slow, the rewards are often not worth it with the exception of the final tiers. No way to unlock content faster without paying a large amount of money. Toxicity and other issues from 1 are still present.

â— Game looks incredible and runs very well too, lots of graphical customization.
â— Gameplay is solid, many different characters and ways to approach a game and situation.
â— Many QoL features.
â— It's free.
â— Requires a battle.net account.
â— Not many active players, especially on higher tier of competitive.
â— Increasingly complex the more characters are added, not friendly with new players.

I've spent hundreds of hours on OW1 when it came out, and played for plenty of years until 2019. Nowadays considering everything Blizzard has done, it makes me incredibly sad with just how low this franchise reached. All the broken promises, incredibly missing opportunities, bad takes and choices, it saddens for me to say this but it just doesn't deserve to be mainstream anymore. Try the game if you'd like, some of my favorite memories in all of gaming came from Highlights of OW1 but with the direction OW2 is going, I won't be a part of it.
i was a huge ow1 fan but now they are a terrible company.
